listitem.para: enum FLASH_Status{FLASH_BUSY== 1, FLASH_ERROR_PGS, FLASH_ERROR_PGP, FLASH_ERROR_PGA, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION, FLASH_COMPLETE}
FLASH_Status FLASH_EraseSector ( uint32_t FLASH_Sector, uint8_t VoltageRange)
FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramDoubleWord ( uint32_t Address, uint64_t Data)
FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramWord ( uint32_t Address, uint32_t Data)
FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramHalfWord ( uint32_t Address, uint16_t Data)
FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramByte ( uint32_t Address, uint8_t Data)
void FLASH_OB_WRPConfig ( uint32_t OB_WRP, FunctionalState NewState)
void FLASH_OB_UserConfig ( uint8_t OB_IWDG, uint8_t OB_STOP, uint8_t OB_STDBY)
void FLASH_ITConfig ( uint32_t FLASH_IT, FunctionalState NewState)

section.title: enum FLASH_Status
section.para:
Definition at line 47 of file stm32f4xx_flash.h
{ FLASH_BUSY== 1, FLASH_ERROR_PGS, FLASH_ERROR_PGP, FLASH_ERROR_PGA, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION, FLASH_COMPLETE, }FLASH_Status;

section.title: void FLASH_SetLatency (uint32_t FLASH_Latency)
section.emphasis: Sets the code latency value.

entry.para:
specifies the FLASH Latency value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
FLASH_Latency_0: FLASH Zero Latency cycle
FLASH_Latency_1: FLASH One Latency cycle
FLASH_Latency_2: FLASH Two Latency cycles
FLASH_Latency_3: FLASH Three Latency cycles
FLASH_Latency_4: FLASH Four Latency cycles
FLASH_Latency_5: FLASH Five Latency cycles
FLASH_Latency_6: FLASH Six Latency cycles
FLASH_Latency_7: FLASH Seven Latency cycles

section.title: void FLASH_PrefetchBufferCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the Prefetch Buffer.

entry.para: new state of the Prefetch Buffer. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void FLASH_InstructionCacheCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the Instruction Cache feature.

entry.para: new state of the Instruction Cache. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void FLASH_DataCacheCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the Data Cache feature.

entry.para: new state of the Data Cache. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void FLASH_InstructionCacheReset (void)
section.emphasis: Resets the Instruction Cache.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function must be used only when the Instruction Cache is disabled.

section.title: void FLASH_DataCacheReset (void)
section.emphasis: Resets the Data Cache.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function must be used only when the Data Cache is disabled.

section.title: void FLASH_Unlock (void)
section.emphasis: Unlocks the FLASH control register access.

section.title: void FLASH_Lock (void)
section.emphasis: Locks the FLASH control register access.

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_EraseSector (uint32_t FLASH_Sector, uint8_t VoltageRange)
section.emphasis: Erases a specified FLASH Sector.

entry.para: The Sector number to be erased. This parameter can be a value between FLASH_Sector_0 and FLASH_Sector_11

The device voltage range which defines the erase parallelism. This parameter can be one of the following values:
VoltageRange_1: when the device voltage range is 1.8V to 2.1V, the operation will be done by byte (8-bit)
VoltageRange_2: when the device voltage range is 2.1V to 2.7V, the operation will be done by half word (16-bit)
VoltageRange_3: when the device voltage range is 2.7V to 3.6V, the operation will be done by word (32-bit)
VoltageRange_4: when the device voltage range is 2.7V to 3.6V + External Vpp, the operation will be done by double word (64-bit)
Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_EraseAllSectors (uint8_t VoltageRange)
section.emphasis: Erases all FLASH Sectors.

entry.para:
The device voltage range which defines the erase parallelism. This parameter can be one of the following values:
VoltageRange_1: when the device voltage range is 1.8V to 2.1V, the operation will be done by byte (8-bit)
VoltageRange_2: when the device voltage range is 2.1V to 2.7V, the operation will be done by half word (16-bit)
VoltageRange_3: when the device voltage range is 2.7V to 3.6V, the operation will be done by word (32-bit)
VoltageRange_4: when the device voltage range is 2.7V to 3.6V + External Vpp, the operation will be done by double word (64-bit)
Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramDoubleWord (uint32_t Address, uint64_t Data)
section.emphasis: Programs a double word (64-bit) at a specified address.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function must be used when the device voltage range is from 2.7V to 3.6V and an External Vpp is present.

entry.para: specifies the address to be programmed.
specifies the data to be programmed.
Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramWord (uint32_t Address, uint32_t Data)
section.emphasis: Programs a word (32-bit) at a specified address.

entry.para: specifies the address to be programmed. This parameter can be any address in Program memory zone or in OTP zone.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function must be used when the device voltage range is from 2.7V to 3.6V.

entry.para: specifies the data to be programmed.
Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramHalfWord (uint32_t Address, uint16_t Data)
section.emphasis: Programs a half word (16-bit) at a specified address.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function must be used when the device voltage range is from 2.1V to 3.6V.

entry.para: specifies the address to be programmed. This parameter can be any address in Program memory zone or in OTP zone.
specifies the data to be programmed.
Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_ProgramByte (uint32_t Address, uint8_t Data)
section.emphasis: Programs a byte (8-bit) at a specified address.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function can be used within all the device supply voltage ranges.

entry.para: specifies the address to be programmed. This parameter can be any address in Program memory zone or in OTP zone.
specifies the data to be programmed.
Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: void FLASH_OB_Unlock (void)
section.emphasis: Unlocks the FLASH Option Control Registers access.

section.title: void FLASH_OB_Lock (void)
section.emphasis: Locks the FLASH Option Control Registers access.

section.title: void FLASH_OB_WRPConfig (uint32_t OB_WRP, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the write protection of the desired sectors.

entry.para:
specifies the sector(s) to be write protected or unprotected. This parameter can be one of the following values:
OB_WRP: A value between OB_WRP_Sector0 and OB_WRP_Sector11
OB_WRP_Sector_All
new state of the Write Protection. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void FLASH_OB_RDPConfig (uint8_t OB_RDP)
section.emphasis: Sets the read protection level.

entry.para:
specifies the read protection level. This parameter can be one of the following values:
OB_RDP_Level_0: No protection
OB_RDP_Level_1: Read protection of the memory
OB_RDP_Level_2: Full chip protection
!!!Warning!!! When enabling OB_RDP level 2 it's no more possible to go back to level 1 or 0

section.title: void FLASH_OB_UserConfig (uint8_t OB_IWDG, uint8_t OB_STOP, uint8_t OB_STDBY)
section.emphasis: Programs the FLASH User Option Byte: IWDG_SW / RST_STOP / RST_STDBY.

entry.para:
Selects the IWDG mode This parameter can be one of the following values:
OB_IWDG_SW: Software IWDG selected
OB_IWDG_HW: Hardware IWDG selected

Reset event when entering STOP mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
OB_STOP_NoRST: No reset generated when entering in STOP
OB_STOP_RST: Reset generated when entering in STOP

Reset event when entering Standby mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
OB_STDBY_NoRST: No reset generated when entering in STANDBY
OB_STDBY_RST: Reset generated when entering in STANDBY

section.title: void FLASH_OB_BORConfig (uint8_t OB_BOR)
section.emphasis: Sets the BOR Level.

entry.para:
specifies the Option Bytes BOR Reset Level. This parameter can be one of the following values:
OB_BOR_LEVEL3: Supply voltage ranges from 2.7 to 3.6 V
OB_BOR_LEVEL2: Supply voltage ranges from 2.4 to 2.7 V
OB_BOR_LEVEL1: Supply voltage ranges from 2.1 to 2.4 V
OB_BOR_OFF: Supply voltage ranges from 1.62 to 2.1 V

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_OB_Launch (void)
section.emphasis: Launch the option byte loading.

entry.para: Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: uint8_t FLASH_OB_GetUser (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the FLASH User Option Bytes values.

entry.para: FLASH User Option Bytes values: IWDG_SW(Bit0), RST_STOP(Bit1) and RST_STDBY(Bit2).

section.title: uint16_t FLASH_OB_GetWRP (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the FLASH Write Protection Option Bytes value.

entry.para: FLASH Write Protection Option Bytes value

section.title: FlagStatus FLASH_OB_GetRDP (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the FLASH Read Protection level.

entry.para:
ReadOut Protection Status:
SET, when OB_RDP_Level_1 or OB_RDP_Level_2 is set
RESET, when OB_RDP_Level_0 is set

section.title: uint8_t FLASH_OB_GetBOR (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the FLASH BOR level.

entry.para:
FLASH BOR level:
OB_BOR_LEVEL3: Supply voltage ranges from 2.7 to 3.6 V
OB_BOR_LEVEL2: Supply voltage ranges from 2.4 to 2.7 V
OB_BOR_LEVEL1: Supply voltage ranges from 2.1 to 2.4 V
OB_BOR_OFF : Supply voltage ranges from 1.62 to 2.1 V

section.title: void FLASH_ITConfig (uint32_t FLASH_IT, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the specified FLASH interrupts.

entry.para:
specifies the FLASH interrupt sources to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
FLASH_IT_ERR: FLASH Error Interrupt
FLASH_IT_EOP: FLASH end of operation Interrupt

section.title: FlagStatus FLASH_GetFlagStatus (uint32_t FLASH_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified FLASH flag is set or not.

entry.para:
specifies the FLASH flag to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
FLASH_FLAG_EOP: FLASH End of Operation flag
FLASH_FLAG_OPERR: FLASH operation Error flag
FLASH_FLAG_WRPERR: FLASH Write protected error flag
FLASH_FLAG_PGAERR: FLASH Programming Alignment error flag
FLASH_FLAG_PGPERR: FLASH Programming Parallelism error flag
FLASH_FLAG_PGSERR: FLASH Programming Sequence error flag
FLASH_FLAG_BSY: FLASH Busy flag
new state of FLASH_FLAG (SET or RESET).

section.title: void FLASH_ClearFlag (uint32_t FLASH_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Clears the FLASH's pending flags.

entry.para:
specifies the FLASH flags to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
FLASH_FLAG_EOP: FLASH End of Operation flag
FLASH_FLAG_OPERR: FLASH operation Error flag
FLASH_FLAG_WRPERR: FLASH Write protected error flag
FLASH_FLAG_PGAERR: FLASH Programming Alignment error flag
FLASH_FLAG_PGPERR: FLASH Programming Parallelism error flag
FLASH_FLAG_PGSERR: FLASH Programming Sequence error flag

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_GetStatus (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the FLASH Status.

entry.para: Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.

section.title: FLASH_Status FLASH_WaitForLastOperation (void)
section.emphasis: Waits for a FLASH operation to complete.

entry.para: Status: The returned value can be: FLASH_BUSY, FLASH_ERROR_PROGRAM, FLASH_ERROR_WRP, FLASH_ERROR_OPERATION or FLASH_COMPLETE.
